results.title: Round the twist: spaghetti pig out
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Chaos reigns after a bolt of lightning hits the video remote control - it works on people! Pause, rewind and fast-forward have amusing consequences, particularly at the spaghetti eating competition.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
results.description: Chaos reigns after a bolt of lightning hits the video remote control - it works on people! Pause, rewind and fast-forward have amusing consequences, particularly at the spaghetti eating competition.

results.title: Round the twist: skeleton on the dunny
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When the Twists move from the city to live in an old lighthouse, they discover that the outside dunny is haunted. One stormy night they decide to have a showdown with a very flushed ghost.

results.title: Round the twist: Santa Claws
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Mark Lewis, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Pete’s dream comes true when he meets Santa Claws Number 115,302 who grants each member of the Twist family two wishes, something they all end up wishing had never happened.

results.title: Round the twist: Lucky Lips
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Pete becomes irresistible to women with the help of some magic lipstick. Dad wants the lipstick too but Gribble Junior steals it, much to his regret.

results.title: Round the twist: lighthouse blues
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Gribble and his partner evict the Twists from the lighthouse in order to build an amusement park. But with the help of some friendly ghosts, the Twists win the battle to save their home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist: know all
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twists find a trunk full of old circus costumes and dress the scarecrow in a clown’s outfit. But the scarecrow comes to life and chases Linda. Fortunately Dad, dressed as a fortune teller, sees and knows all.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist: birdsdo
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Nell is committed to hospital for believing in dragons; so Linda, Pete and Bronson set off to prove her sanity. While rogue seagulls imprison Linda and Pete in a shack buried in bird droppings, Bronson finds the dragon’s egg and Nell is released.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: #MorbiusSweep
results.material_description: Digital Screen Recording of @RickOpsYT's twitter feed
results.brief_description: MorbiusSweep refers to a series of parody memes celebrating the 2022 superhero film Morbius as a massive commercial and critical success, despite the tepid response from the public. This particular tweet is packed full of faked references to fan and critical touchpoints, such as Director Martin Scorsese’s much publicised view that “Superhero films are not cinema”.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

MorbiusSweep refers to a series of parody memes celebrating the 2022 superhero film Morbius as a massive commercial and critical success, despite the tepid response from the public. This tweet mixes well-known memes full of faked references to fan and critical touchpoints, such as director Martin Scorsese’s much publicised view that “Superhero films are not cinema”, and satirically highlights how fandoms attempt to hijack critical responses by flooding Rotten Tomatoes with disingenuous reviews, laying bare the intersection between internet hype and movie success.
description_for_label: #MorbiusSweep refers to a series of parody memes celebrating the 2022 superhero film Morbius as a massive commercial and critical success, despite the tepid response from the public. This tweet mixes well-known memes full of faked references to fan and critical touchpoints, such as director Martin Scorsese’s much publicised view that “Superhero films are not cinema”, and satirically highlights how fandoms attempt to hijack critical responses by flooding Rotten Tomatoes with disingenuous reviews, laying bare the intersection between internet hype and movie success.

results.title: The Sound of a Meringue Being Tortured
results.creator_credit: Antony Riddell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. A stop-motion animated short film where the characters repeatedly ask ‘Are you alright, mate?’.
